meanings.definition: The quality or state of being bad
meanings.sent1: The badnesses of the storm caused damage to the houses.
meanings.sent2: She could sense the badnesses in the air before the thunderstorm arrived.
meanings.sent3: The badnesses of the spoiled milk made the cat turn away in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The badnesses of the situation lingered like a dark cloud over their heads.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's disappointment was palpable due to the badnesses of the students' behavior.

meanings.definition: Actions or behavior that are morally wrong or evil
meanings.sent1: The badnesses of lying eventually caught up with him.
meanings.sent2: The villain reveled in the badnesses of his deeds, relishing the chaos he caused.
meanings.sent3: The badnesses of stealing cookies from the jar were evident on his guilty face.
meanings.sent4: The badnesses of his betrayal cut deeper than any physical wound.
meanings.sent5: The badnesses of the crime scene left a chilling impression on the detective.
